p: Our starting point is the site distribution plot on the modern ombrotype map ( Fig 1), based on the observation that the annual ombrotype distribution during the LGM was not particularly different than today [ 24]. Moist ombrotypes in North-West Africa, Southern and Northern Iberia are overrepresented in respect to site numbers ( Fig 2); this points to a preferential selection of areas which are today moister–and possibly were as well in the past–by hunter-gatherers. This preference might have been crucial during the well documented dry spells such as HS 1 within the Last Glacial in the Western Mediterranean.
